scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of letters, 1851-1881, bound in an extra-illustrated copy of Recollectionswhich are to or from people mentioned in the book. These include letters from G.P.R. James on the consulate at Norfolk, Va., Hablot Knight Brown on graphotypes, Lytton Bulwer on a charitable request, William Howitt requesting Irish sketches from Carlton, and a patronage request from Simon Cameron to President Grant.

Also Charles Dickens on funeral arrangements, Samuel Randall and William T. Sherman conveying personal news, Ralph Waldo Emerson, Henry W. Longfellow and Fitz-Greene Halleck sending regrets, Matthew Arnold sending thanks, and George Bancroft sending checks.
The letters are tipped in George William Child's Recollections, J. B. Lippincott, 1890, in the Manuscripts Department, in the order in which they fall.

did.unittitle: George Bancroft to R. Withers 1851 Aug 16

scopecontent.p: Sends two checks ($500 and $351) to credit his account
Discusses his labors in putting the consulate in Norfolk, Virginia into order
Concerns arrangements for funeral of W. Fleming

did.unittitle: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow to "Dear Sir" 1877 Apr 19

scopecontent.p: Has no material on subject requested

did.unittitle: Hablot Knight Browne to H. Ftizcocke n.d.

scopecontent.p: Prefers graphotype to woodcutting because it render artwork more faithfully

did.unittitle: R[obert?]Patterson to George William Childs 1881 Mar 17

scopecontent.p: Recommends William N. Clifford as correspondent

did.unittitle: Samuel Randall to S. C. Lyford 1881 Dec 30

scopecontent.p: Is at a New York hotel. Thanks for sending [Borup's?] letter. Will be glad to hear of S. C. L.'s travels
Is glad to hear of correspondent's new job. Gives travel schedule; plans to attend son Tom's graduation exercises at Yale. Refers to desk which has not arrived.

did.unittitle: Ralph Waldo Emerson to [John] Bigelow 1857 Sep 24

scopecontent.p: Cannot go to Cleveland; will try later in the season
Asks correspondent to corroborate story of a cripple named Addison, and to give him money

did.unittitle: Matthew Arnold to "My dear Sir" 1875 Jan 10

scopecontent.p: Regrets that he did not see Professor in Edinburg; thanks him for lectures on Turgot

did.unittitle: William Howitt to Richard Webb [1847] Mar 2

scopecontent.p: Refers to Webb's letter to "William," and to the warfare between two journals. Would like some Irish sketches from Carlton

did.unittitle: Fitz-Greene Halleck to Homer V. Smith 1861 Jan 24

scopecontent.p: Regrets he cannot honor request for "four lines" -- it is too long since he has attempted anything

did.unittitle: Charles Dickens sending regards to Mrs. [Annie Adams?] Fields on his calling card n.d.
Simon Cameron to President [Ulysses Simpson] Grant 1876 Jun 26

scopecontent.p: Recommends Mr. Leisinning's case objecting to being replaced by Turner Schley as postmaster of Charleston, West Virginia
